reviews.review_text:
I've been using Persil Laundry Detergent for a while now, and I have to say, it's one of the best laundry detergents I've ever used. Not only does it clean my clothes exceptionally well, but it also lasts much longer than other detergents I've tried in the past.

One of the things I love most about Persil is how concentrated it is. You only need to use a small amount per load, which means the bottle lasts significantly longer than regular, diluted detergents. Despite using less product, Persil still manages to get my clothes looking and smelling incredibly fresh and clean.

The cleaning power of this detergent is truly impressive. It tackles even the toughest stains with ease, leaving my whites brighter and my colors more vibrant. I've noticed a remarkable difference in the cleanliness of my laundry since switching to Persil.

Another great aspect of this detergent is its scent. Persil has a fresh, clean aroma that I absolutely love. It's not overpowering or artificial-smelling – just a pleasant, natural fragrance that lingers on my clothes after they've been washed.

What's even better is that the concentrated formula not only saves me money in the long run (since I don't have to buy detergent as often), but it's also more environmentally friendly. Using less product means fewer resources are consumed and less waste is produced.

Overall, I couldn't be happier with Persil Laundry Detergent. It's a powerful, long-lasting, and great-smelling detergent that consistently delivers outstanding results. If you're looking for a detergent that truly gets your clothes clean while also providing great value for your money, Persil is definitely the way to go.

For tuffer stains, that can be removed, with more elbow grease and/or soak times, I will apply and either soak, from hours to a day, or just pour on direct. Are the results perfect? No, but they are what I would consider excellent stain fighting results. As for freshness, although the aroma my dissipate in the dryer, or reduce the longer-term freshness aroma, there is an aroma and it is one of freshness. Now, of course, there is no accounting for taste, or smell, but so far, it seems universally appealing to most. As for hanging the clothes, I have to hang indoors, and the fresh aroma is nice in the area where the clothes are drying. Once again, when dry, the aroma is much more limited. The price is competitive, however, for something that I finds that works, the detergent does offer excellent value.

reviews.review_text:
Persil Original Everyday Clean has been my laundry wingman since I stumbled on it in 2020. Between my warehouse shifts and my husband’s long hours on the line as a chef, we produce some impressively grimy clothes—grease splatters, dust, the occasional sauce explosion. One tiny line of this 2X‑concentrated HE formula (the 82.5 fl oz jug promises 110 loads) whips a full washer into a thick, sudsy clean, so even our double‑wash weeks only burn through a bottle every three to four months.

Performance‑wise, it’s hard to beat: the deep‑stain enzymes lift out ground‑in dirt without a pre‑soak, and the fresh, just‑air‑dried scent lingers for days longer than the big‑box brands I used to buy. At roughly $6.5-$8.67 a month, it feels like a stealth deal considering the level of clean we get. Whites stay bright, darks don’t fade, and my husband’s chef coats pass the “sniff test” after a single cycle—no small feat. I don't even need to use those fabric conditioners that add to the fragrant smell.

A couple of nitpicks: the bottle is hefty, so I sometimes pour more than necessary. The scent can also feel strong straight out of the washer if you’re fragrance‑sensitive, though it settles once the clothes dry. Even with those quirks, Persil’s cleaning power and budget‑friendly longevity make it a staple in our laundry lineup—well worth the shelf space in the utility room.

I’ve been a loyal Persil user for a while now—after years of using Tide, I made the switch and haven’t looked back. The Original scent is one of the main reasons I love this detergent so much—it’s clean, fresh, and unique. I usually buy the larger tub with the spout from Target, but this time I went with this Amazon deal because the price was too good to pass up.

While the detergent still works great—clothes come out clean and fresh—this particular bottle doesn’t smell the same as the others I’ve purchased from Target or Walmart. The scent is noticeably different… almost more cologne-like? It’s not bad, just not the same “Original” I know and love. The only thing I can think of is that this version is more concentrated (2X), and maybe that affects the fragrance? Not sure, but it’s disappointing since the scent is a big part of why I use Persil in the first place.

Unfortunately, I won’t be purchasing this version again. It could have been a bad batch, but I’ll stick to the ones I’ve had better luck with in-store.

reviews.review_title: Great for Food Service Uniform Odors
reviews.review_text:
As much as I love the ecofriendly product I used to buy here I found that after about a year of working in a food service job it just wasn't getting the smell out of my uniforms. Stale grease is a terrible smell to be overpowered by when you put on a freshly laundered shirt. I tried several special products designed to get such odors out with very little success. Then one day I was frustratedly looking at options in the store when a man there randomly recommend Persil. It was a brand I had seen but never tried before. Since it was a reasonably priced choice with lots of purported benefits I bought a bottle to try expecting it wouldn't help when expensive products designed for greasy odors hadn't. It wasn't a complete cure at first but there was a significant decrease after just one wash. Since then I've gone on to use the Subscribe and Save option here so that I never run out.

It's great for grease and food odors has only slightly increased the fading rate on my black uniform pants versus my eco-friendly favorite, and has been a good choice for all of my laundry since. I wish I could thank that random stranger who said it was the best because it totally saved my sanity to not smell bad in clean clothes. I very much recommend Persil and this concentrated version in particular since it saves a lot of space in my laundry room.

reviews.review_title: Clean clothes with very little expense
reviews.review_text:
I purchased this after receiving a free sample from a local grocer.
Normally would never think to spend this amount of money on a single bottle of detergent, but the scent was the most alluring factor and as it is enough for three months of laundry, I justified it.
The scent is still as I remember it. For some reason, other brands I’ve used in the past eventually end up smelling bad after a few months ( the PRODUCT is fine, but my nose is NOT).
Even the big brands “pods” have started to leave a scent that makes me think I left something in the machine too long (when I run a wash and dry load in under two hours- so that is impossible) And I WASH my washing machine once a week out of precaution!!!
But Persil still smells CLEAN. And I’m further impressed but that fact that the little amount I need to use in my machine is actually HALF of what the “pod” contains! Stains are lifted, less to rewash, and I have more of my days back!
The only thing that could make this better is if the price could come down, even a smidge. But knowing what I know now, I’m glad I used subscribe and save - so I only have to feel that sting once

reviews.review_text:
I’m picky in general about how I do my laundry and that includes laundry detergent. Persil is my favorite, hands down. Everything comes out clean, whites stay white (I sort those out though and wash with light colors), colors stay bright and I wear a lot of black and no fading.

My work clothes get absolutely gross, my jeans get this grimy film on them you can feel after one shift and I get all kinds of spills and dirt on my work clothes. I don’t have to pretreat or add anything else to my wash and it all comes out clean, no stains (I’ve gotten coffee on white undershirts, blue icee syrup from a broken bib, motor oil, diesel fuel, god knows what from a leaking garbage bag, a lot of stuff I’ll just put it that way) and they smell nice but not strong. I have very sensitive skin and eczema, I’ve never had a problem with this causing flare ups.

I use the washing machines at my apt that are older top load machines, nothing special, or machines at the laundromat.

reviews.review_text:
I've been using Persil Laundry Detergent for a while now, and I have to say, it's one of the best laundry detergents I've ever used. Not only does it clean my clothes exceptionally well, but it also lasts much longer than other detergents I've tried in the past.

One of the things I love most about Persil is how concentrated it is. You only need to use a small amount per load, which means the bottle lasts significantly longer than regular, diluted detergents. Despite using less product, Persil still manages to get my clothes looking and smelling incredibly fresh and clean.

The cleaning power of this detergent is truly impressive. It tackles even the toughest stains with ease, leaving my whites brighter and my colors more vibrant. I've noticed a remarkable difference in the cleanliness of my laundry since switching to Persil.

Another great aspect of this detergent is its scent. Persil has a fresh, clean aroma that I absolutely love. It's not overpowering or artificial-smelling – just a pleasant, natural fragrance that lingers on my clothes after they've been washed.

What's even better is that the concentrated formula not only saves me money in the long run (since I don't have to buy detergent as often), but it's also more environmentally friendly. Using less product means fewer resources are consumed and less waste is produced.

Overall, I couldn't be happier with Persil Laundry Detergent. It's a powerful, long-lasting, and great-smelling detergent that consistently delivers outstanding results. If you're looking for a detergent that truly gets your clothes clean while also providing great value for your money, Persil is definitely the way to go.

reviews.review_text:
Persil Original Everyday Clean has been my laundry wingman since I stumbled on it in 2020. Between my warehouse shifts and my husband’s long hours on the line as a chef, we produce some impressively grimy clothes—grease splatters, dust, the occasional sauce explosion. One tiny line of this 2X‑concentrated HE formula (the 82.5 fl oz jug promises 110 loads) whips a full washer into a thick, sudsy clean, so even our double‑wash weeks only burn through a bottle every three to four months.

Performance‑wise, it’s hard to beat: the deep‑stain enzymes lift out ground‑in dirt without a pre‑soak, and the fresh, just‑air‑dried scent lingers for days longer than the big‑box brands I used to buy. At roughly $6.5-$8.67 a month, it feels like a stealth deal considering the level of clean we get. Whites stay bright, darks don’t fade, and my husband’s chef coats pass the “sniff test” after a single cycle—no small feat. I don't even need to use those fabric conditioners that add to the fragrant smell.

A couple of nitpicks: the bottle is hefty, so I sometimes pour more than necessary. The scent can also feel strong straight out of the washer if you’re fragrance‑sensitive, though it settles once the clothes dry. Even with those quirks, Persil’s cleaning power and budget‑friendly longevity make it a staple in our laundry lineup—well worth the shelf space in the utility room.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025

reviews.review_title: Great Clean, But the Scent Just Isn't the Same
reviews.review_text:
I’ve been a loyal Persil user for a while now—after years of using Tide, I made the switch and haven’t looked back. The Original scent is one of the main reasons I love this detergent so much—it’s clean, fresh, and unique. I usually buy the larger tub with the spout from Target, but this time I went with this Amazon deal because the price was too good to pass up.

While the detergent still works great—clothes come out clean and fresh—this particular bottle doesn’t smell the same as the others I’ve purchased from Target or Walmart. The scent is noticeably different… almost more cologne-like? It’s not bad, just not the same “Original” I know and love. The only thing I can think of is that this version is more concentrated (2X), and maybe that affects the fragrance? Not sure, but it’s disappointing since the scent is a big part of why I use Persil in the first place.

Unfortunately, I won’t be purchasing this version again. It could have been a bad batch, but I’ll stick to the ones I’ve had better luck with in-store.

reviews.review_title: Great for Food Service Uniform Odors
reviews.review_text:
As much as I love the ecofriendly product I used to buy here I found that after about a year of working in a food service job it just wasn't getting the smell out of my uniforms. Stale grease is a terrible smell to be overpowered by when you put on a freshly laundered shirt. I tried several special products designed to get such odors out with very little success. Then one day I was frustratedly looking at options in the store when a man there randomly recommend Persil. It was a brand I had seen but never tried before. Since it was a reasonably priced choice with lots of purported benefits I bought a bottle to try expecting it wouldn't help when expensive products designed for greasy odors hadn't. It wasn't a complete cure at first but there was a significant decrease after just one wash. Since then I've gone on to use the Subscribe and Save option here so that I never run out.

It's great for grease and food odors has only slightly increased the fading rate on my black uniform pants versus my eco-friendly favorite, and has been a good choice for all of my laundry since. I wish I could thank that random stranger who said it was the best because it totally saved my sanity to not smell bad in clean clothes. I very much recommend Persil and this concentrated version in particular since it saves a lot of space in my laundry room.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020

reviews.review_title: Clean clothes with very little expense
reviews.review_text:

Normally would never think to spend this amount of money on a single bottle of detergent, but the scent was the most alluring factor and as it is enough for three months of laundry, I justified it.
The scent is still as I remember it. For some reason, other brands I’ve used in the past eventually end up smelling bad after a few months ( the PRODUCT is fine, but my nose is NOT).
Even the big brands “pods” have started to leave a scent that makes me think I left something in the machine too long (when I run a wash and dry load in under two hours- so that is impossible) And I WASH my washing machine once a week out of precaution!!!
But Persil still smells CLEAN. And I’m further impressed but that fact that the little amount I need to use in my machine is actually HALF of what the “pod” contains! Stains are lifted, less to rewash, and I have more of my days back!
The only thing that could make this better is if the price could come down, even a smidge. But knowing what I know now, I’m glad I used subscribe and save - so I only have to feel that sting once

reviews.review_title: Works well at less than recommended dosage
reviews.review_text:
I've used Persil standard concentration before and bought the 2× original scent when it went on sale. At recommended dosage, I find Persil makes a lot of suds and is difficult to rinse out of the wash load. With my new, large-capacity washer, I've cut the amount of detergent to two teaspoons of concentrated Persil for a medium load, 10 to 15 pounds of laundry. I get good stain lifting and odor removal, plus almost no suds and the detergent rinses out. The wet clothes still have a very faint perfume scent after a single rinse, but it's good enough for our household, where no one is sensitive to laundry detergents.

I dislike pouring small volumes from large bottles—I'm too clumsy. I use a condiment squeeze bottle (what you might use for a ketchup squeeze container) to hold a smaller amount of Persil and then I put the large bottle away. I also found an old set of measuring spoons that contained a dessert spoon measure—a dessert spoon equals two teaspoons (about 10 mls). The combination solved that laundry-day annoyance for me.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019

reviews.review_text: We love this product to the moon and back! We began buying it via Amazon because it was a couple dollars cheaper and we could setup a recurring order. However, after 4 rounds of shipments, we had the cancel the recurring orders and begin buying local. The first bottle was a "sign of trouble" that we didn't quite catch; the order was supposed to arrive as planned and then suddenly, we received notice it was returned back to Amazon. We just got a return credit and the order stated canceled. The second round, was returned again to Amazon a day before it was to arrive. On the third attempt and the day it was to arrive- no notices of it being returned. With fingers crossed, we watched for our U.S.P.S driver. He came to the door carrying the box that was stuffed in a shopping bag that was too small for the box. He sat the box down on our sidewalk, very upset and said, "Good luck with that. Now I have to go clean my truck out before I can continue my route." The leak flooded his truck and he happened to have a bag to get around the box. After we opened the box, it was flooded with the liquid. The cap wasn't even half screwed on. Amazon graciously refunded the order. A few weeks later, we ordered again- the box arrived undamaged, but the liquid was leaking out of the seams again. The bottle was laying on its side, the lid was so loose it rattled on the neck. Less than a third of the bottle was remaining. Amazon did refund us yet again as we shared pictures with them bofore and after the box was opened, but that was our last order. My heart still goes out to the postal driver. Not sure if it was a deliberate act when the product was boxed, or if the Amazon distribution center has frequent earthquakes. Neither of the two shipments we received were packed in damaged boxes, nor were the bottles damaged. The original Amazon sealing tape was perfectly in place... just a little soggy and blue. ;)

reviews.review_title: Pleasant Scent, Got Clothes Clean as Name Brand Detergents at a Fraction of the Cost
reviews.review_text: I don’t ask much when it comes to laundry detergent - all I want is a detergent that gets my clothes clean, smells pleasant, doesn’t cause any allergic reactions, and doesn’t cost me an arm and a leg to buy. The Persil laundry detergent fulfilled all my requirements. The detergent is thinner than other detergents I’ve used and doesn’t require as much detergent to get a load clean. The detergent dissolves well in my HE washer, got a load of laundry clean and spot free, and the scent is really quite nice. Stains came out effectively and the detergent didn’t seem to damage any of the clothes. In terms of cost, this detergent is very reasonably priced and seems to work just as well as name brand detergents. The only complaint I have about this particular brand is the bottle top. When pouring out the detergent, some of the detergent that got caught in the “spill over” area of the cap didn’t get drained back completely into the bottle so some detergent spilled out while I was pouring and filling the cap. This isn’t a huge issue, but is a small design flaw. You may need to tip back the bottle a bit to make sure all the detergent drains back into the main part of the bottle before pouring. That little flaw aside, this detergent worked perfectly at a fraction of the cost of name brand. Overall, it’s a great detergent a very reasonable price.

reviews.review_title: The detergent is fine, but the cap is not
reviews.review_text:
I have no problems with how well this functions as a detergent. It seems fine, and leaves clothes with only a faint, pleasant smell.

But, the bottle cap is a real problem. It is actually two parts: The red pour spout, which can be unscrewed from the blue bottle, and the clear cap which closes the red pour spout. There are a couple issues with this 2-part cap design.

First, you have two threaded parts that have to form an excellent seal against the other parts if you don't want the bottle to leak. Most bottles only have one place they could leak. This has two.

Second, and more importantly, the clear plastic lid does not form a good seal against the red pour spout (and so the rest of the bottle). These bottles absolutely will leak if not kept upright.

This isn't some rare manufacturing defect. I've had it happen to me with at least 3 different bottles of this detergent. It can both leak during shipping (I've been lucky so far in that there was nothing else in the boxes that the detergent would destroy), and in your home if the bottle gets knocked over.

Given how frequent leaking is, I assume the company must be aware of this issue. If they aren't, then I hope this review prompts them to address this problem.

Unless I hear that this problem has been resolved, I probably will not buy this detergent again. There are plenty of other good detergents to choose from that do not pose a leak hazard.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021

reviews.review_text:
I started using the original Persil laundry detergent after reading strong recommendations from a leading consumer testing site and have been very happy with its cleaning effectiveness. I wash standard family clothing, with food stains, yardwork, etc. No auto mechanics or similar challenging tasks very often! I decided to try this version because my usual pick was out of stock, and I like it even better.
It washes as well as my usual version, and the scent is NOT too strong.
The best part, though, is the dispensing cap. Unlike the previous version and many other detergents, it screws on tightly. You can use the cap to measure the amount of detergent you will use, or, as I do, you can easily pour directly into your washer. A VERY nice improvement!

reviews.review_title: PERSIL = Great Product; Buying on Amazon = QUESTIONABLE
reviews.review_text:
Persil is my favorite Laundry Detergent. I've used it for over 6 years since first discovering it while living in Europe. A friend of mine purchased THIS version from Amazon for me and had it shipped directly to me.
What I received IS NOT representative of the product; the product I received is WATERED DOWN.
I estimate this particular item is approx 1/3 less formula 1/3 excess water.
What should be 110 Loads = 8-10 Loads; I've had to use 3 capfuls just to generate effective cleaning of my clothes in a Large Capacity Washing Machine. Typically, I use only 1 capful of the REAL product.
BUYER BEWARE when purchasing online such products that can be open and tampered with.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021

reviews.review_text:

reviews.review_title: A little bit goes a long way
reviews.review_text:
I have used pretty much every type of laundry detergent you can imagine. This goes from the old dry soap style all the way through to the little plastic pods. Everything seems to work as it should so the main thing one needs to worry about is getting the biggest bang for the buck. You get 110 loads here and the amount suggested works fine. You add the small amount and your clothes come out clean and fresh smelling.

I did not try this on old stains because I really dont have anything with older stains. I did use it on grease, blood, grass stains and food stains. The detergent worked at removing these stains and I really have nothing negative to say about how it worked. A big positive for me was it didnt leave a smell on my clothes.

This is a good product. As I stated in my original statement, most products work the same and you want to have the smallest footprint possible. This is pretty small and I really like it.

all_reviews.review_text:
I've been using Persil Laundry Detergent for a while now, and I have to say, it's one of the best laundry detergents I've ever used. Not only does it clean my clothes exceptionally well, but it also lasts much longer than other detergents I've tried in the past.

One of the things I love most about Persil is how concentrated it is. You only need to use a small amount per load, which means the bottle lasts significantly longer than regular, diluted detergents. Despite using less product, Persil still manages to get my clothes looking and smelling incredibly fresh and clean.

The cleaning power of this detergent is truly impressive. It tackles even the toughest stains with ease, leaving my whites brighter and my colors more vibrant. I've noticed a remarkable difference in the cleanliness of my laundry since switching to Persil.

Another great aspect of this detergent is its scent. Persil has a fresh, clean aroma that I absolutely love. It's not overpowering or artificial-smelling – just a pleasant, natural fragrance that lingers on my clothes after they've been washed.

What's even better is that the concentrated formula not only saves me money in the long run (since I don't have to buy detergent as often), but it's also more environmentally friendly. Using less product means fewer resources are consumed and less waste is produced.

Overall, I couldn't be happier with Persil Laundry Detergent. It's a powerful, long-lasting, and great-smelling detergent that consistently delivers outstanding results. If you're looking for a detergent that truly gets your clothes clean while also providing great value for your money, Persil is definitely the way to go.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2024

all_reviews.review_text: I’m a Persil user for life! It’s by-far the best detergent I’ve used. Always gets stains and smells out without added soaking and scrubbing. It also smells great!

all_reviews.review_title: Stains Out; Freshness In; Concentrated, So, Lots More Loads; Blue in Color Liquid.
all_reviews.review_text:
I have successfully used Persil for several years now. Realistic stains are removed through the wash, such as aromatic residues and stains from childrens pants, shorts, and underclothes with no visible rashes or irritations. For tuffer stains, that can be removed, with more elbow grease and/or soak times, I will apply and either soak, from hours to a day, or just pour on direct. Are the results perfect? No, but they are what I would consider excellent stain fighting results. As for freshness, although the aroma my dissipate in the dryer, or reduce the longer-term freshness aroma, there is an aroma and it is one of freshness. Now, of course, there is no accounting for taste, or smell, but so far, it seems universally appealing to most. As for hanging the clothes, I have to hang indoors, and the fresh aroma is nice in the area where the clothes are drying. Once again, when dry, the aroma is much more limited. The price is competitive, however, for something that I finds that works, the detergent does offer excellent value.

Country of origin?
USA.

all_reviews.review_text:
Persil Original Everyday Clean has been my laundry wingman since I stumbled on it in 2020. Between my warehouse shifts and my husband’s long hours on the line as a chef, we produce some impressively grimy clothes—grease splatters, dust, the occasional sauce explosion. One tiny line of this 2X‑concentrated HE formula (the 82.5 fl oz jug promises 110 loads) whips a full washer into a thick, sudsy clean, so even our double‑wash weeks only burn through a bottle every three to four months.

Performance‑wise, it’s hard to beat: the deep‑stain enzymes lift out ground‑in dirt without a pre‑soak, and the fresh, just‑air‑dried scent lingers for days longer than the big‑box brands I used to buy. At roughly $6.5-$8.67 a month, it feels like a stealth deal considering the level of clean we get. Whites stay bright, darks don’t fade, and my husband’s chef coats pass the “sniff test” after a single cycle—no small feat. I don't even need to use those fabric conditioners that add to the fragrant smell.

A couple of nitpicks: the bottle is hefty, so I sometimes pour more than necessary. The scent can also feel strong straight out of the washer if you’re fragrance‑sensitive, though it settles once the clothes dry. Even with those quirks, Persil’s cleaning power and budget‑friendly longevity make it a staple in our laundry lineup—well worth the shelf space in the utility room.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Clean, But the Scent Just Isn't the Same
all_reviews.review_text:
I’ve been a loyal Persil user for a while now—after years of using Tide, I made the switch and haven’t looked back. The Original scent is one of the main reasons I love this detergent so much—it’s clean, fresh, and unique. I usually buy the larger tub with the spout from Target, but this time I went with this Amazon deal because the price was too good to pass up.

While the detergent still works great—clothes come out clean and fresh—this particular bottle doesn’t smell the same as the others I’ve purchased from Target or Walmart. The scent is noticeably different… almost more cologne-like? It’s not bad, just not the same “Original” I know and love. The only thing I can think of is that this version is more concentrated (2X), and maybe that affects the fragrance? Not sure, but it’s disappointing since the scent is a big part of why I use Persil in the first place.

Unfortunately, I won’t be purchasing this version again. It could have been a bad batch, but I’ll stick to the ones I’ve had better luck with in-store.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for Food Service Uniform Odors
all_reviews.review_text:
As much as I love the ecofriendly product I used to buy here I found that after about a year of working in a food service job it just wasn't getting the smell out of my uniforms. Stale grease is a terrible smell to be overpowered by when you put on a freshly laundered shirt. I tried several special products designed to get such odors out with very little success. Then one day I was frustratedly looking at options in the store when a man there randomly recommend Persil. It was a brand I had seen but never tried before. Since it was a reasonably priced choice with lots of purported benefits I bought a bottle to try expecting it wouldn't help when expensive products designed for greasy odors hadn't. It wasn't a complete cure at first but there was a significant decrease after just one wash. Since then I've gone on to use the Subscribe and Save option here so that I never run out.

It's great for grease and food odors has only slightly increased the fading rate on my black uniform pants versus my eco-friendly favorite, and has been a good choice for all of my laundry since. I wish I could thank that random stranger who said it was the best because it totally saved my sanity to not smell bad in clean clothes. I very much recommend Persil and this concentrated version in particular since it saves a lot of space in my laundry room.

all_reviews.review_title: Clean clothes with very little expense
all_reviews.review_text:
I purchased this after receiving a free sample from a local grocer.
Normally would never think to spend this amount of money on a single bottle of detergent, but the scent was the most alluring factor and as it is enough for three months of laundry, I justified it.
The scent is still as I remember it. For some reason, other brands I’ve used in the past eventually end up smelling bad after a few months ( the PRODUCT is fine, but my nose is NOT).
Even the big brands “pods” have started to leave a scent that makes me think I left something in the machine too long (when I run a wash and dry load in under two hours- so that is impossible) And I WASH my washing machine once a week out of precaution!!!
But Persil still smells CLEAN. And I’m further impressed but that fact that the little amount I need to use in my machine is actually HALF of what the “pod” contains! Stains are lifted, less to rewash, and I have more of my days back!
The only thing that could make this better is if the price could come down, even a smidge. But knowing what I know now, I’m glad I used subscribe and save - so I only have to feel that sting once

I’m picky in general about how I do my laundry and that includes laundry detergent. Persil is my favorite, hands down. Everything comes out clean, whites stay white (I sort those out though and wash with light colors), colors stay bright and I wear a lot of black and no fading.

My work clothes get absolutely gross, my jeans get this grimy film on them you can feel after one shift and I get all kinds of spills and dirt on my work clothes. I don’t have to pretreat or add anything else to my wash and it all comes out clean, no stains (I’ve gotten coffee on white undershirts, blue icee syrup from a broken bib, motor oil, diesel fuel, god knows what from a leaking garbage bag, a lot of stuff I’ll just put it that way) and they smell nice but not strong. I have very sensitive skin and eczema, I’ve never had a problem with this causing flare ups.

I use the washing machines at my apt that are older top load machines, nothing special, or machines at the laundromat.

The only other detergent it’s comparable to is Tide but Tide is not good in comparison. I have to sit around and pretreat, etc. if I use that.

This detergent bottle has no actual stopper, just a measuring "cap" that screws on. Either it doesn't fit properly or it wasn't screwed on properly. ONE-THIRD of the detergent had leaked out. The inside of the box was saturated. The box the scale came in was saturated and falling apart. Fortunately, the scale was inside its own plastic sleeve and didn't have any detergent in it. It took half an hour to get the soap film rinsed off the detergent bottle and spatula and the outside of the food scale's plastic sleeve. It is concentrated so extra difficult, I guess. BUT, the final note, this product SMELLS way more than is necessary. I usually buy scent-free detergents but thought I'd try this because it was highly rated. Big mistake. I will try to find someone who needs detergent and doesn't mind the scent. So, Persil and Amazon, pay attention to how you package.

all_reviews.review_text:
I've been using Persil Laundry Detergent for a while now, and I have to say, it's one of the best laundry detergents I've ever used. Not only does it clean my clothes exceptionally well, but it also lasts much longer than other detergents I've tried in the past.

One of the things I love most about Persil is how concentrated it is. You only need to use a small amount per load, which means the bottle lasts significantly longer than regular, diluted detergents. Despite using less product, Persil still manages to get my clothes looking and smelling incredibly fresh and clean.

The cleaning power of this detergent is truly impressive. It tackles even the toughest stains with ease, leaving my whites brighter and my colors more vibrant. I've noticed a remarkable difference in the cleanliness of my laundry since switching to Persil.

Another great aspect of this detergent is its scent. Persil has a fresh, clean aroma that I absolutely love. It's not overpowering or artificial-smelling – just a pleasant, natural fragrance that lingers on my clothes after they've been washed.

What's even better is that the concentrated formula not only saves me money in the long run (since I don't have to buy detergent as often), but it's also more environmentally friendly. Using less product means fewer resources are consumed and less waste is produced.

Overall, I couldn't be happier with Persil Laundry Detergent. It's a powerful, long-lasting, and great-smelling detergent that consistently delivers outstanding results. If you're looking for a detergent that truly gets your clothes clean while also providing great value for your money, Persil is definitely the way to go.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2024

Still I wish Persil would make a powder or rather sell a powder I have water here already!! all_reviews.review_text:
Persil Original Everyday Clean has been my laundry wingman since I stumbled on it in 2020. Between my warehouse shifts and my husband’s long hours on the line as a chef, we produce some impressively grimy clothes—grease splatters, dust, the occasional sauce explosion. One tiny line of this 2X‑concentrated HE formula (the 82.5 fl oz jug promises 110 loads) whips a full washer into a thick, sudsy clean, so even our double‑wash weeks only burn through a bottle every three to four months.

Performance‑wise, it’s hard to beat: the deep‑stain enzymes lift out ground‑in dirt without a pre‑soak, and the fresh, just‑air‑dried scent lingers for days longer than the big‑box brands I used to buy. At roughly $6.5-$8.67 a month, it feels like a stealth deal considering the level of clean we get. Whites stay bright, darks don’t fade, and my husband’s chef coats pass the “sniff test” after a single cycle—no small feat. I don't even need to use those fabric conditioners that add to the fragrant smell.

A couple of nitpicks: the bottle is hefty, so I sometimes pour more than necessary. The scent can also feel strong straight out of the washer if you’re fragrance‑sensitive, though it settles once the clothes dry. Even with those quirks, Persil’s cleaning power and budget‑friendly longevity make it a staple in our laundry lineup—well worth the shelf space in the utility room.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: Great Clean, But the Scent Just Isn't the Same
all_reviews.review_text:
I’ve been a loyal Persil user for a while now—after years of using Tide, I made the switch and haven’t looked back. The Original scent is one of the main reasons I love this detergent so much—it’s clean, fresh, and unique. I usually buy the larger tub with the spout from Target, but this time I went with this Amazon deal because the price was too good to pass up.

While the detergent still works great—clothes come out clean and fresh—this particular bottle doesn’t smell the same as the others I’ve purchased from Target or Walmart. The scent is noticeably different… almost more cologne-like? It’s not bad, just not the same “Original” I know and love. The only thing I can think of is that this version is more concentrated (2X), and maybe that affects the fragrance? Not sure, but it’s disappointing since the scent is a big part of why I use Persil in the first place.

Unfortunately, I won’t be purchasing this version again. It could have been a bad batch, but I’ll stick to the ones I’ve had better luck with in-store.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: Great for Food Service Uniform Odors
all_reviews.review_text:
As much as I love the ecofriendly product I used to buy here I found that after about a year of working in a food service job it just wasn't getting the smell out of my uniforms. Stale grease is a terrible smell to be overpowered by when you put on a freshly laundered shirt. I tried several special products designed to get such odors out with very little success. Then one day I was frustratedly looking at options in the store when a man there randomly recommend Persil. It was a brand I had seen but never tried before. Since it was a reasonably priced choice with lots of purported benefits I bought a bottle to try expecting it wouldn't help when expensive products designed for greasy odors hadn't. It wasn't a complete cure at first but there was a significant decrease after just one wash. Since then I've gone on to use the Subscribe and Save option here so that I never run out.

It's great for grease and food odors has only slightly increased the fading rate on my black uniform pants versus my eco-friendly favorite, and has been a good choice for all of my laundry since. I wish I could thank that random stranger who said it was the best because it totally saved my sanity to not smell bad in clean clothes. I very much recommend Persil and this concentrated version in particular since it saves a lot of space in my laundry room.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020

all_reviews.review_title: Clean clothes with very little expense
all_reviews.review_text:
I purchased this after receiving a free sample from a local grocer.
Normally would never think to spend this amount of money on a single bottle of detergent, but the scent was the most alluring factor and as it is enough for three months of laundry, I justified it.
The scent is still as I remember it. For some reason, other brands I’ve used in the past eventually end up smelling bad after a few months ( the PRODUCT is fine, but my nose is NOT).
Even the big brands “pods” have started to leave a scent that makes me think I left something in the machine too long (when I run a wash and dry load in under two hours- so that is impossible) And I WASH my washing machine once a week out of precaution!!!
But Persil still smells CLEAN. And I’m further impressed but that fact that the little amount I need to use in my machine is actually HALF of what the “pod” contains! Stains are lifted, less to rewash, and I have more of my days back!
The only thing that could make this better is if the price could come down, even a smidge. But knowing what I know now, I’m glad I used subscribe and save - so I only have to feel that sting once

all_reviews.review_title: Works well at less than recommended dosage
all_reviews.review_text:
I've used Persil standard concentration before and bought the 2× original scent when it went on sale. At recommended dosage, I find Persil makes a lot of suds and is difficult to rinse out of the wash load. With my new, large-capacity washer, I've cut the amount of detergent to two teaspoons of concentrated Persil for a medium load, 10 to 15 pounds of laundry. I get good stain lifting and odor removal, plus almost no suds and the detergent rinses out. The wet clothes still have a very faint perfume scent after a single rinse, but it's good enough for our household, where no one is sensitive to laundry detergents.

I dislike pouring small volumes from large bottles—I'm too clumsy. I use a condiment squeeze bottle (what you might use for a ketchup squeeze container) to hold a smaller amount of Persil and then I put the large bottle away. I also found an old set of measuring spoons that contained a dessert spoon measure—a dessert spoon equals two teaspoons (about 10 mls). The combination solved that laundry-day annoyance for me.

all_reviews.review_text: We love this product to the moon and back! We began buying it via Amazon because it was a couple dollars cheaper and we could setup a recurring order. However, after 4 rounds of shipments, we had the cancel the recurring orders and begin buying local. The first bottle was a "sign of trouble" that we didn't quite catch; the order was supposed to arrive as planned and then suddenly, we received notice it was returned back to Amazon. We just got a return credit and the order stated canceled. The second round, was returned again to Amazon a day before it was to arrive. On the third attempt and the day it was to arrive- no notices of it being returned. With fingers crossed, we watched for our U.S.P.S driver. He came to the door carrying the box that was stuffed in a shopping bag that was too small for the box. He sat the box down on our sidewalk, very upset and said, "Good luck with that. Now I have to go clean my truck out before I can continue my route." The leak flooded his truck and he happened to have a bag to get around the box. After we opened the box, it was flooded with the liquid. The cap wasn't even half screwed on. Amazon graciously refunded the order. A few weeks later, we ordered again- the box arrived undamaged, but the liquid was leaking out of the seams again. The bottle was laying on its side, the lid was so loose it rattled on the neck. Less than a third of the bottle was remaining. Amazon did refund us yet again as we shared pictures with them bofore and after the box was opened, but that was our last order. My heart still goes out to the postal driver. Not sure if it was a deliberate act when the product was boxed, or if the Amazon distribution center has frequent earthquakes. Neither of the two shipments we received were packed in damaged boxes, nor were the bottles damaged. The original Amazon sealing tape was perfectly in place... just a little soggy and blue. ;)
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021

all_reviews.review_title: Pleasant Scent, Got Clothes Clean as Name Brand Detergents at a Fraction of the Cost
all_reviews.review_text: I don’t ask much when it comes to laundry detergent - all I want is a detergent that gets my clothes clean, smells pleasant, doesn’t cause any allergic reactions, and doesn’t cost me an arm and a leg to buy. The Persil laundry detergent fulfilled all my requirements. The detergent is thinner than other detergents I’ve used and doesn’t require as much detergent to get a load clean. The detergent dissolves well in my HE washer, got a load of laundry clean and spot free, and the scent is really quite nice. Stains came out effectively and the detergent didn’t seem to damage any of the clothes. In terms of cost, this detergent is very reasonably priced and seems to work just as well as name brand detergents. The only complaint I have about this particular brand is the bottle top. When pouring out the detergent, some of the detergent that got caught in the “spill over” area of the cap didn’t get drained back completely into the bottle so some detergent spilled out while I was pouring and filling the cap. This isn’t a huge issue, but is a small design flaw. You may need to tip back the bottle a bit to make sure all the detergent drains back into the main part of the bottle before pouring. That little flaw aside, this detergent worked perfectly at a fraction of the cost of name brand. Overall, it’s a great detergent a very reasonable price.

all_reviews.review_title: The detergent is fine, but the cap is not
all_reviews.review_text:
I have no problems with how well this functions as a detergent. It seems fine, and leaves clothes with only a faint, pleasant smell.

But, the bottle cap is a real problem. It is actually two parts: The red pour spout, which can be unscrewed from the blue bottle, and the clear cap which closes the red pour spout. There are a couple issues with this 2-part cap design.

First, you have two threaded parts that have to form an excellent seal against the other parts if you don't want the bottle to leak. Most bottles only have one place they could leak. This has two.

Second, and more importantly, the clear plastic lid does not form a good seal against the red pour spout (and so the rest of the bottle). These bottles absolutely will leak if not kept upright.

This isn't some rare manufacturing defect. I've had it happen to me with at least 3 different bottles of this detergent. It can both leak during shipping (I've been lucky so far in that there was nothing else in the boxes that the detergent would destroy), and in your home if the bottle gets knocked over.

Given how frequent leaking is, I assume the company must be aware of this issue. If they aren't, then I hope this review prompts them to address this problem.

Unless I hear that this problem has been resolved, I probably will not buy this detergent again. There are plenty of other good detergents to choose from that do not pose a leak hazard.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021

My work clothes get absolutely gross, my jeans get this grimy film on them you can feel after one shift and I get all kinds of spills and dirt on my work clothes. I don’t have to pretreat or add anything else to my wash and it all comes out clean, no stains (I’ve gotten coffee on white undershirts, blue icee syrup from a broken bib, motor oil, diesel fuel, god knows what from a leaking garbage bag, a lot of stuff I’ll just put it that way) and they smell nice but not strong. I use the washing machines at my apt that are older top load machines, nothing special, or machines at the laundromat.

all_reviews.review_title: Been Using this brand for Years
all_reviews.review_text: Has been a great laundry soap for us. We have used this brand for years on everyday clothes, very dirty clothes (working on ranch/farm), and work clothes. Take note of the measuring marks on the cap, as it is easy to over use/pour the soap. I feel this is an issue with most laundry soaps to get people to over use the product. I've used Persil to pretreat as well. I add the soap to a little water and thoroughly soak the stain/spot and let it sit for 15+ minutes. Works great!

all_reviews.review_title: Hands Down the Best Laundry Detergent
all_reviews.review_text: I love how clean just a tiny amount of Persil HE gets my clothes. You really only need a quarter capful for regular loads. Don't use too much of this (or any HE laundry detergent). It doesn't get your clothes cleaner and it is bad for the environment. I love the smell of this product as well. Subtle and not over-powering like many other detergents on the market.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024

all_reviews.review_text:
I started using the original Persil laundry detergent after reading strong recommendations from a leading consumer testing site and have been very happy with its cleaning effectiveness. I wash standard family clothing, with food stains, yardwork, etc. No auto mechanics or similar challenging tasks very often! I decided to try this version because my usual pick was out of stock, and I like it even better.
It washes as well as my usual version, and the scent is NOT too strong.
The best part, though, is the dispensing cap. Unlike the previous version and many other detergents, it screws on tightly. You can use the cap to measure the amount of detergent you will use, or, as I do, you can easily pour directly into your washer. A VERY nice improvement!
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022

The original scent is pleasant and not overpowering. I have purchased the "intense fresh" scent before and I find it to be a bit overbearing.

all_reviews.review_title: PERSIL = Great Product; Buying on Amazon = QUESTIONABLE
all_reviews.review_text:
Persil is my favorite Laundry Detergent. I've used it for over 6 years since first discovering it while living in Europe. A friend of mine purchased THIS version from Amazon for me and had it shipped directly to me.
What I received IS NOT representative of the product; the product I received is WATERED DOWN.
I estimate this particular item is approx 1/3 less formula 1/3 excess water.
What should be 110 Loads = 8-10 Loads; I've had to use 3 capfuls just to generate effective cleaning of my clothes in a Large Capacity Washing Machine. Typically, I use only 1 capful of the REAL product.
BUYER BEWARE when purchasing online such products that can be open and tampered with.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021

all_reviews.review_text:
Persil HE concentrate cleans laundry effectively, and leaves my wash smelling fresh, not overly fragrant. My colors stay vivid, and bright.

The measuring cap is smaller than those of other HE detergents, and its uppermost level can take on a large load with ease.

I love how well Persil cleans. I am always happy with the results. It’s great for families of all sizes.

all_reviews.review_title: A little bit goes a long way
all_reviews.review_text:
I have used pretty much every type of laundry detergent you can imagine. This goes from the old dry soap style all the way through to the little plastic pods. Everything seems to work as it should so the main thing one needs to worry about is getting the biggest bang for the buck. You get 110 loads here and the amount suggested works fine. You add the small amount and your clothes come out clean and fresh smelling.

I did not try this on old stains because I really dont have anything with older stains. I did use it on grease, blood, grass stains and food stains. The detergent worked at removing these stains and I really have nothing negative to say about how it worked. A big positive for me was it didnt leave a smell on my clothes.

This is a good product. As I stated in my original statement, most products work the same and you want to have the smallest footprint possible. This is pretty small and I really like it.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018

What I can honestly tell you is the apartment ends up smelling like it had been given an industrial type cleansing. It is way to strong smelling for both of us and my wife won't use it. I don't like everything we wash smelling like that either. Because it is concentrated you do get a fair amount of loads from the container. Others may be okay with the smell but not us so won't be buying again.
